event.summary: 08/23/1993: Unidentified militants in a passing red Fiat hurled a bomb into the stolen vehicle division of a police station in east-central Caracas. No one was injured.
event.motive: Possibly to destroy evidence pertaining to a car bomb that exploded in a shopping mall parking garage the previous week.
event.propcomment: The interior of the police station was severely damaged; most of the stolen vehicle archives were destroyed.
event.scite1: “Bomb thrown into police building causes damage,” Agence France Presse, August 24, 1993.
event.scite2: “Venezuela: Tensions increase after police station bomb,” IPS-Inter Press Service, August 24, 1993.
event.scite3: Alberto Garnica, “Former Venezuelan president rejects bomb accusations,” United Press International, August 24, 1993.
